original_solution_mapping.L2: The wide flags each use 15 feet of fabric per flag because five times three equals <<5*3=15>>15
original_solution_mapping.L3: The tall flags each use 15 feet of fabric per flag because five times three equals <<5*3=15>>15
original_solution_mapping.L4: He has used 256 square feet for the square flags because 16 times 16 equals <<16*16=256>>256
original_solution_mapping.L5: He has used 300 square feet for the wide flags because 20 times 15 equals <<20*15=300>>300
original_solution_mapping.L6: He has used 150 square feet for the tall flags because ten times 15 equals 150.
original_solution_mapping.L7: He has used 706 square feet because 256 plus 300 plus 150 equals <<256+300+150=706>>706.
original_solution_mapping.L8: He has 294 square feet left because 1,000 minus 706 equals <<1000-706=294>>294

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3769.
    Returns: the number of square feet of fabric Darnell has left.
    """
    # L1
    square_flag_side = 4 # 4 feet by 4 feet
    fabric_per_square_flag = square_flag_side * square_flag_side

    # L2
    wide_flag_length = 5 # 5 feet by 3 feet
    wide_flag_width = 3 # 5 feet by 3 feet
    fabric_per_wide_flag = wide_flag_length * wide_flag_width

    # L3
    tall_flag_length = 3 # 3 feet by 5 feet
    tall_flag_width = 5 # 3 feet by 5 feet
    fabric_per_tall_flag = tall_flag_width * tall_flag_length

    # L4
    num_square_flags = 16 # already made 16 square flags
    total_fabric_square_flags = num_square_flags * fabric_per_square_flag

    # L5
    num_wide_flags = 20 # 20 wide flags
    total_fabric_wide_flags = num_wide_flags * fabric_per_wide_flag

    # L6
    num_tall_flags = 10 # 10 tall flags
    total_fabric_tall_flags = num_tall_flags * fabric_per_tall_flag

    # L7
    total_fabric_used = total_fabric_square_flags + total_fabric_wide_flags + total_fabric_tall_flags

    # L8
    initial_fabric = 1000 # 1000 square feet of fabric
    fabric_left = initial_fabric - total_fabric_used

    # FA
    answer = fabric_left
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The square flags use {fabric_per_square_flag} square feet of fabric per flag because {square_flag_side} times {square_flag_side} equals <<{square_flag_side}*{square_flag_side}={fabric_per_square_flag}>>{fabric_per_square_flag}

The wide flags each use {fabric_per_wide_flag} feet of fabric per flag because {wide_flag_length} times {wide_flag_width} equals <<{wide_flag_length}*{wide_flag_width}={fabric_per_wide_flag}>>{fabric_per_wide_flag}

The tall flags each use {fabric_per_tall_flag} feet of fabric per flag because {tall_flag_width} times {tall_flag_length} equals <<{tall_flag_width}*{tall_flag_length}={fabric_per_tall_flag}>>{fabric_per_tall_flag}

He has used {total_fabric_square_flags} square feet for the square flags because {num_square_flags} times {fabric_per_square_flag} equals <<{num_square_flags}*{fabric_per_square_flag}={total_fabric_square_flags}>>{total_fabric_square_flags}

He has used {total_fabric_wide_flags} square feet for the wide flags because {num_wide_flags} times {fabric_per_wide_flag} equals <<{num_wide_flags}*{fabric_per_wide_flag}={total_fabric_wide_flags}>>{total_fabric_wide_flags}
He has used {total_fabric_tall_flags} square feet for the tall flags because {num_tall_flags} times {fabric_per_tall_flag} equals {total_fabric_tall_flags}.

He has used {total_fabric_used} square feet because {total_fabric_square_flags} plus {total_fabric_wide_flags} plus {total_fabric_tall_flags} equals <<{total_fabric_square_flags}+{total_fabric_wide_flags}+{total_fabric_tall_flags}={total_fabric_used}>>{total_fabric_used}.
He has {fabric_left} square feet left because {initial_fabric} minus {total_fabric_used} equals <<{initial_fabric}-{total_fabric_used}={fabric_left}>>{fabric_left}
